intro: Canthium oblongifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf cowcalf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are usually hairy and have a rough texture. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Canthium oblongifolium is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along stream banks, contributing to the ecological diversity of these habitats.
